newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonia shares boosted by bank news, Hansa leads.
newsitem.headline: Estonia shares boosted by bank news, Hansa leads.

text.p: The Estonian stock exchange was more active on Thursday, given a kick by latest bank and company results, dealers said.
Total trade on the main list was 30.8 million kroons with the Talse 0.8 percent up at 252.39. Trade yesterday was 19.8 million kroons.
Hansapank was most active to gain 2.42 kroons to 131.17 kroons on trade worth 7.7 million kroons.
"It seems that investors are more choosy and need more information on company fundamentals to make their decisions, then they did some months ago," one dealer said.
Several leading banks released their May earnings figures, including second and third placed banks Hoiupank and Uhispank.
"It was the amount of information from the banks that helped the bourse along," another trader said.
"The market should be active tomorrow as well, as people digest the news from today," another added.
Hoiupank turned over 7.1 million kroons on the strength of its May results to gain 0.10 kroons to 132.30 kroons.

Hoiupank said it made a record profit in May of 18.1 million kroons. Forekspank said its May profit was 5.1 million kroons. Dealers said that although the figure was as expected, the stock has underperformed.
Uhispank released a profit figure lower than April at nine million kroons but picked up 0.15 kroons to close on 52.30 kroons after turning over 5.6 million kroons.
Baltika, a clothing maker and retailer, made its debut on the bourse. Baltika turned over 1.5 million kroons to close at 45.85 kroons after reaching a high of 48.00 kroons.
Viisnurk, a ski and furniture maker, was the other first-timer with its share price hitting 240 kroons during the day to close on 225 kroons on a trade of 1.5 million kroons.
The free market turned over 3.5 million kroons down on Wednesday's total of 4.6 million kroons.
